text: The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the Sun.
Light takes 8 minutes to travel from the Sun to Earth.
A human brain can power a 20-watt light bulb.
Honey has been found in 3,000-year-old Egyptian tombs, still edible.
The tongue is the only muscle attached at one end.
Sound travels 4.3 times faster in water than air.
The Amazon produces 20% of Earth's oxygen.
Your DNA could stretch from the Sun to Pluto and back 17 times.
Lightning strikes Earth about 100 times per second.
A fetus develops fingerprints at 3 months old.
The universe is 13.8 billion years old.
Your eyes remain the same size from birth, but ears and nose grow.
A sneeze can travel at over 100 miles per hour.
The Great Barrier Reef can be seen from space.
Humans and bananas share 60% of their DNA.
It takes 8 minutes for sunlight to reach Earth.
Your blood vessels would wrap around Earth 2.5 times.
The brain is 73% water.
Earth spins at 1,000 mph at the equator.
There are more bacterial cells in your body than human cells.
The universe has more stars than grains of sand on Earth.
Your body produces 25 million new cells per second.
A single lightning bolt can cook 100,000 pieces of toast.
The Sahara Desert was once a lush tropical forest.
An average cloud weighs 1.1 million pounds.
The sun accounts for 99.86% of the solar system's mass.
A day on Mars is 24 hours and 37 minutes.
Water can exist as solid, liquid, and gas at the triple point.
Your heart will beat about 3 billion times in your lifetime.
The deepest part of the ocean is 36,000 feet down.
An adult human body contains about 100,000 miles of blood vessels.
The Moon moves 3.8 cm away from Earth each year.
Light travels 186,000 miles per second.
A cubic inch of bone can bear 19,000 pounds of weight.
The coldest temperature possible is -459.67°F (absolute zero).
Your heart pumps about 2,000 gallons of blood per day.
The Milky Way contains 100-400 billion stars.
Human bone is stronger than concrete.
A neutron star is so dense a teaspoon weighs 6 billion tons.
The average person produces 25,000 quarts of saliva in their lifetime.
Black holes can evaporate over time.
Your small intestine is about 20 feet long.
The Sun is 400 times larger than the Moon.
A human head remains conscious for about 20 seconds after decapitation.
The universe is expanding faster than the speed of light.
Your stomach acid is strong enough to dissolve metal.
Venus is the hottest planet at 900°F despite not being closest to Sun.
The human eye can detect about 10 million different colors.
A supernova can outshine an entire galaxy.
Your nose can remember 50,000 different scents.
The Sun converts 4 million tons of mass to energy each second.
Human teeth are as hard as shark teeth.
There are more possible chess games than atoms in the universe.
Your liver performs over 500 different functions.
Pluto is smaller than the Moon.
The average person walks 100,000 miles in their lifetime.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is larger than Earth.
Your brain uses 20% of your body's total energy.
Saturn would float in water due to its low density.
A human produces enough saliva to fill 2 swimming pools.
Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system.
Your skin is your largest organ at about 20 square feet.
The Sun is 93 million miles from Earth.
Humans shed about 600,000 skin particles per hour.
Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system at 1,200 mph.
Your body produces about 1-1.5 liters of saliva per day.
The observable universe is 93 billion light-years across.
Your lungs have the same surface area as a tennis court.
The Sun is 4.6 billion years old.
An adult human has about 206 bones.
Mercury has no atmosphere because it's too small.
Your brain generates about 70,000 thoughts per day.
Uranus rotates on its side.
Red blood cells live for about 120 days.
The Sun is 1.3 million times larger than Earth by volume.
Your body contains about 0.2 mg of gold.
A day on Uranus lasts 17 hours.
The human heart creates enough pressure to squirt blood 30 feet.
The Sun loses 4 million tons of mass every second.
Your fingernails grow about 3.5 mm per month.
Earth is the only planet not named after a god.
Your brain is about 60% fat.
The largest known star is 1,700 times bigger than the Sun.
Humans blink about 15-20 times per minute.
Jupiter has 95 known moons.
Your taste buds are replaced every 10 days.
The Moon is 238,855 miles from Earth.
Adults have fewer bones than babies.
One year on Neptune equals 165 Earth years.
Your stomach produces a new lining every 3-4 days.
The asteroid belt contains millions of asteroids.
You produce about 40,000 liters of spit in a lifetime.
Halley's Comet appears every 76 years.
Your brain can survive 5-10 minutes without oxygen.
The Moon's gravity causes Earth's tides.
Humans spend 1/3 of their life sleeping.
There are more than 100 billion galaxies in the universe.
Your nose can detect over 1 trillion scents.
Black holes were predicted by Einstein's theory.
The average person dreams 4-6 times per night.
